newsitem.title: GERMANY: Deutsche says Q1 pre-tax profit up 28 pct.
newsitem.headline: Deutsche says Q1 pre-tax profit up 28 pct.

text.p: Deutsche Bank AG, Germany's largest commercial bank, said on Tuesday group pre-tax profit rose 28 percent to 1.29 billion marks in the first quarter of 1997.
The bank said in a mandatory statement released before its annual shareholders' meeting that group operating profit after risk provisions rose 21.0 percent to 1.40 billion marks.
Trading profit rose by 43.6 percent in the period to 1.0 billion marks while loan loss provisions fell 29.1 percent to 288 million marks, the bank said.
Group net interest income rose 4.1 percent to 2.76 billion marks, while net commission income rose 18.1 percent to 1.98 billion marks.
Administration costs rose 15.3 percent to 4.25 billion marks.

Management board member Rolf Breuer takes over as Deutsche's new chief executive after the shareholder meeting, replacing Hilmar Kopper who moves up to become chairman of the bank's non-executive supervisory board.
